parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.
Festus. Of Latin derivation; festal; Phestus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To be raving mad, speak as a madman. Middle voice from a primary mao; to rave as a 'maniac'.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From grapho; a writing, i.e. A letter, note, epistle, book, etc. plural learning.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn round, turn, change. From peri and the base of trope; to turn around, i.e. to craze.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Raving madness, frenzy, insanity. From mainomai; craziness.
